page.title: 14S.P.A.R.E. V S.E.B. (ctd).
page.content: see them and they will not spoil the countryside.This is how S.P.A.R.E. was formed. A 30 metre strip will be cut through the forest and pylons would be put in the space,where they could be seen.If the underground cables were laid not as many trees would have to be felled,and there would be only \ metre strip.A representative from S.P.A.R.E. and one from S.E.B. came to talk to us.They explained that it was mainly a matter of money-the underground cables costing Â£6m more than pylons.A Public Enquiry was held, the results will be known in a year. Most of us support S.P.A.R.E, especially Mark Garvey who would have a pylon in the field behind his house.
